article_title: ‘The Driver’ Review: On the Road to Hell
article_text: There is no way to know from the opening scene of “The Driver,” involving a wild car chase, that what’s about to unfold is a drama that encompasses great themes—the claims of conscience, the call of temptation, the indissoluble ties that bind families. Or that the death grip in which it holds your attention will never for a moment relax in this three-part tale of Vince McKee (a sterling David Morrissey). Vince is a driver for a taxi service in Manchester, England—a man who’s catapulted from his humdrum job, his depression over...

twitter.description: When a cabbie gets hired as the driver for a local crime boss, his new duties take a toll on his conscience and his family. ‘The Driver’ stars David Morrissey, Ian Hart, Colm Meaney, Claudie Blakley and Sacha Parkinson
twitter.title: ‘The Driver’ Review: On the Road to Hell

image.alt: A cabbie’s conscience suffers after he gets hired as the driver for a local crime boss in ‘The Driver’

article_summary:
Vince is a driver for a taxi service in Manchester, England—a man who’s catapulted from his humdrum job, his depression over...
Or that the death grip in which it holds your attention will never for a moment relax in this three-part tale of Vince McKee (a sterling David Morrissey).
There is no way to know from the opening scene of “The Driver,” involving a wild car chase, that what’s about to unfold is a drama that encompasses great themes—the claims of conscience, the call of temptation, the indissoluble ties that bind families.
